title: Cat. 1  Wine Cup, c. 1660
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">John Hull (American, born England, 1624–1683)  
Robert Sanderson (American, born England, c. 1608–1693)  
Boston, Massachusetts  
Silver; 17.2 × 9.2 × 9.4 cm (6 3/4 × 3 5/8 × 3 11/16 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society; Mary Swissler Oldberg Memorial Fund; restricted gifts of Samuel Mencoff and of Jamee J. and Marshall Field; Mary Swissler Oldberg Fund; restricted gifts of Marilynn Thoma, Mrs. Herbert A. Vance, Erica C. Meyer, National Society of The Colonial Dames of America in the State of Illinois; and Jan and Tom Pavlovic, 2014.995

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">At rim (fig. 1.1)

Engraved on body: The Gift of William Needham to Brantry Church, 1688

Scratched on bottom: 10-17

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">William Needham (c. 1614–1690), c. 1660.

First Congregational Society Church, Quincy (formerly Braintree), MA, 1688–2001.

With Sotheby’s (2001), lot 252.

Private collection, 2001–2014.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2014.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, American Church Silver of the Seventeenth and Eighteenth Century, with a Few Pieces of Domestic Plate, July–December 1911, cat. 592, pl. 19 (ill.).

Possibly Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, 1930, no cat.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Pattee (1878), p. 244.

Berger and Curtis (1911), cat. 592, pl. 19 (ill.).

Jones (1913), p. 395.

Clarke (1940), cat. 21, p. 213.

Kane et al. (1998), pp. 571, 885.

Sotheby’s (2001), pp. 16–19, 19 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Wine Cup, c. 1660.

fig. 1.1 </section>
